title: Harbaugh out as Ravens coach after playoff miss
content: The Ravens fired John Harbaugh, less than 48 hours after losing to the Steelers and failing to reach the playoffs. Sources told ESPN that he is expected to emerge as a favorite for the Giants job but will be in demand for many other teams as well.

title: QB Williams hits portal despite signed UW deal
content: Washington quarterback Demond Williams Jr. said on social media Tuesday night he is entering the transfer portal, a move that comes just days after he agreed to return to the Huskies for the 2026 season.

title: Chambliss pleads case, hopes NCAA OK's waiver
content: Trinidad Chambliss acknowledged being a "little frustrated" as he awaits an NCAA decision on a potential waiver for the 2026 season, while his lawyer, Tom Mars, told ESPN that they're working on immediate contingency plans in the event it's denied.

title: Longhorns great Shipley severely burned on ranch
content: Former Texas Longhorns star Jordan Shipley is in critical but stable condition after suffering "severe" burns in an accident on his ranch in Texas on Tuesday, his family said.

title: Top prospect Peterson forces OT in wild KU rally
content: Kansas freshman Darryn Peterson scored a career-high 32 points, including three free throws to tie the score at the end of regulation, in a 104-100 comeback win over TCU.

title: LeBron says it's on him to bend game around Luka
content: Amid his recent scoring surge, Lakers star LeBron James reiterated Tuesday night that teammate Luka Doncic doesn't "need to bend his game [for me]," adding, "It's up to us to bend our game around him."

title: Declining Devils author 'embarrassing' 9-0 loss
content: The New Jersey Devils, struggling for nearly two months after a scorching 8-1 start, are now searching for answers after a 9-0 loss to the New York Islanders Tuesday, one in which goaltender Jacob Markstrom gave up goals on the first two shots he faced.

title: LSU's Weis with Rebels, has done 'terrific job'
content: Ole Miss offensive assistant Joe Judge praised offensive coordinator Charlie Weis Jr. for how he has been able to juggle his responsibilities with the Rebels and LSU.

title: üîÆ Myth-busters for the 14 NFL playoff teams
content: The Packers need a WR1? The Broncos can't keep winning tight games? The Pats' run defense and the Seahawks' run offense are problems? We're not so sure.

content: One month from the NBA trade deadline, which top contending teams could make a move for a potential playoff push?

content: Young could become the NBA trade season's first domino. Let's help the Hawks find the best move for the  guard.

title: Draft order for Round 1: The first 18 slots are set, and the Raiders will pick at No. 1
content: The Raiders, Jets and Cardinals hold the top three picks in the 2026 NFL draft. See the rest of the order.

title: Inside Raiders' lost 2025 season: Tom Brady's influence, private meetings and dysfunction
content: "Who would want the Raiders job?" The inside story of how the Raiders went from playoff hopes to the No. 1 pick and another fired coach.

content: This year's NFL playoffs will feature three elite defenses -- the Texans, Seahawks and Broncos. What makes each so unstoppable?

title: Connelly breaks down Miami-Ole Miss, Oregon-Indiana
content: Our deep dive into the semifinals dissects the matchups that will determine who moves on to the title game.

title: Wetzel: The big, bad SEC isn't dead. It's just not special anymore
content: The Big Ten is guaranteed to be playing for a third straight national title. Can the SEC find a way to dominate this new era like it did the previous one?

title: Roster overhaul, six pillars and the Pittsburgh Steelers: Inside the Kings' latest revamp
content: The Kings fired Mike Brown this time last season, but one year later don't seem any closer to finding their way.

title: Who are MLB's top young stars? Ranking baseball's best players at every age from 16 to 25
content: Julio Rodriguez or Bobby Witt Jr.? Roman Anthony or Jackson Chourio? We rank baseball's best by birth year.

content: Jaron-Keawe Sagapolutele stayed at Cal, but more often than not, college quarterbacks are on the move

title: Best way to an Eagles defensive lineman's heart -- and performance? Meatballs
content: Vic Fangio introduced the Meatball Award this season for his defense to serve as that extra bit of motivation.

title: Why Khalil Mack returned to the Chargers and how he's become a mentor
content: Mack explains why he returned to L.A. and his relationship with the next defensive star in line, Tuli Tuipulotu.

title: Bracketology: Gonzaga is doing Gonzaga things again
content: Outside of that one blowout loss, the Zags are unbeaten -- and could stay that way until Selection Sunday.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: Michigan State, Kansas stumble
content: Nebraska cracks the top 10. SMU and UCF replace Florida and USC. See more changes after the two-week hiatus.

title: Bracketology: Kentucky is biggest winner as upsets shake up top 16
content: The new year has brought some big upsets, a shake-up of the top 16 seeds and a new-look Bracketology.

title: Who will be Man United's next manager? 12 top candidates to replace Amorim
content: Whether Manchester United aim to hire quickly or wait until summer, here are the coaches they could be after.

title: Is parity in the Premier League a sign of quality -- or do these teams just stink?
content: The gap between 5th place and 14th in the Premier League standings is four points. Does that mean the league is full of good teams, or bad ones?

title: What Rosenior and Fletcher will bring to Chelsea, Man United
content: Chelsea's Liam Rosenior and Man United's Darren Fletcher will take their first steps on a touchline this week.

title: MLB offseason intel: Trade rumors and free agency updates
content: Here's what we're hearing about Ketel Marte, Alex Bregman, Bo Bichette and much more as the hot stove heats back up.

title: Ranking the top American tennis players as 2026 begins
content: Coco Gauff won another major title in 2025, and Taylor Fritz continued to lead the American men. But who else is set to make a move in 2026?

title: 'The 1am op': How demolition drive at Delhi mosque spiralled into chaos - key points
content: A demolition drive by the Municipal Corporation of Delhi near Faiz-e-Ilahi Mosque turned tense as stone-pelting injured police personnel. Authorities registered an FIR and detained individuals, with investigations ongoing using CCTV footage. The operation, ordered by the High Court to remove unauthorized constructions, proceeded with heavy machinery and security.

title: ‚ÄòIt's not baigan‚Äô: TMC mocks sports minister Mandaviya over Mohun Bagan faux pas
content: Union sports minister Mansukh Mandaviya's mispronunciation of Kolkata football club Mohun Bagan drew sharp criticism from the ruling Trinamool Congress. The TMC accused the BJP of showing contempt for Bengal by mangling the names of revered football institutions, calling them symbols of identity and pride. The party slammed the BJP's alleged "Bangla-Birodhi arrogance".

title: T20 WC: ICC forces Bangladesh to play in India? BCB breaks silence
content: BCB president Aminul Islam Bulbul has denied reports that the ICC forced Bangladesh to play all T20 World Cup matches in India, calling them false. He said security concerns remain the board‚Äôs priority and government guidance is required. Bulbul confirmed talks with the ICC, which has shown willingness to cooperate, but Bangladesh will stay firm if safety issues persist.

title: Another Hindu man dies in Bangladesh: Youth drowns in canal; was being chased by mob
content: A Hindu youth, Mithun Sarkar, tragically drowned in Bangladesh after being chased by a mob accusing him of theft. This incident in Naogaon district highlights a disturbing surge in communal violence, with over 50 incidents reported in December alone, including murders, land grabs, and assaults. Authorities are investigating Sarkar's death amidst ongoing unrest.

title: Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk humorously noted China's rapid adoption of his energy suggestions, including massive battery, EV, and solar production. He emphasized batteries as key to increasing energy output, citing Tesla's Megapacks and the new Megablock as solutions for grid stability and AI-driven power demands.

title: IND vs NZ: 'If you're not from Mumbai'- Gaikwad's ODI squad snub stirs fresh debate
content: Ruturaj Gaikwad's omission from India's New Zealand squad, despite a recent century, has sparked debate. Former player Robin Uthappa expressed bewilderment, highlighting the mental strain on players in Indian cricket's 'survival mode.' He emphasized the need for resilience and persistence, especially for those not from traditional cricketing hubs, to navigate selection challenges.

title: 'Not only dog bites': SC flags road accidents due to strays; highlights civic lapses
content: The Supreme Court has flagged civic authorities' lapses, noting that stray animals on roads, not just dog bites, are causing fatalities and accidents. Justices emphasized strict implementation of rules for stray animal management, highlighting the danger posed by roaming animals. The court warned of harsh action against non-compliant states, stressing the need for scientific solutions like the CSVR model.

title: Robust economy! India's GDP growth projected at 7.4% in FY26 - govt releases estimates
content: ‚ÄãIndia's economy will grow at a robust 7.4% in the financial year 2025-26, according to the first advanced estimates of Gross Domestic Product released by the National Statistics Office (NSO). This is much higher than the 6.5% growth in the previous financial year.

title: Apple execs won't leave South Korea: Hunting Samsung, SK Hynix supply; iPhone RAM at risk
content: Tech giants, including Apple, are reportedly camping out in South Korean hotels to secure crucial memory chip supplies.  A global shortage, driven by AI demand, has sent RAM prices soaring, forcing companies to negotiate long-term contracts.  This situation could lead to higher iPhone prices or reduced memory in future models.

title: Unholy alliance? BJP, Cong units tie up for Maha civic body polls; face fire from leadership
content: In Ambernath, the Congress suspended its corporators and block president for aligning with the BJP-led Ambernath Vikas Aghadi to form the civic administration, sidelining the Shiv Sena. This rare local alliance between rivals occurred despite the Shiv Sena emerging as the single largest party in the municipal elections.

title: Ashes | Catching Tendulkar‚Äôs unfathomable 15,921: Root is on his way
content: Joe Root has begun 2026 with a century, his second of the ongoing Ashes in Australia. The 35-year-old needs another 1,978 runs to surpass Sachin Tendulkar‚Äôs long-standing record of 15,921 Test runs, achieved across 329 innings and 200 Tests. Root has so far amassed 13,943 runs from 298 innings in 163 Tests.

title: Telegram CEO 'remembers‚Äô Christmas after 14 days; shares online message
content: In a surprising end-of-year message, Telegram's CEO Pavel Durov urged his followers to reduce their sensory overload, highlighting its detrimental effects on mental health. Durov didn‚Äôt hold back in criticizing the EU's privacy laws, declaring them to be a 'direct attack on personal freedom.

title: Explained: Why NMC shut down the MBBS course at Vaishno Devi medical college in J&K
content: The National Medical Commission withdrew approval for the MBBS course at Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute of Medical Excellence after a surprise inspection found serious deficiencies in faculty, infrastructure and clinical exposure. Despite political protests over student composition, the shutdown was based on regulatory non-compliance. Existing students will be relocated to other medical colleges as supernumerary seats.

title: ‚ÄòMediator for peace‚Äô: S Korea seeks China‚Äôs help to ease tensions with N Korea
content: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung has requested Chinese President Xi Jinping to mediate the North Korean nuclear crisis and ease inter-Korean tensions. Lee emphasized the blocked communication channels with Pyongyang, urging China to act as a peace mediator. Xi stressed the need for patience, while both leaders agreed on the importance of freezing North Korea's nuclear and missile programs.

title: Why Vijay‚Äôs final film Jana Nayagan is caught in a censor storm?
content: Jana Nayagan's January 9th release is in jeopardy due to censorship delays.  Despite prior clearance, the CBFC referred the film for review after a complaint, sparking a legal battle.  Producers argue the action is arbitrary, especially given the film's massive pre-release bookings and Vijay's impending political entry. The Madras High Court is now involved.

title: From $13mn to $8.4b: San Francisco 49ers owner York family net worth
content: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.

title: MLB trade rumors: Blue Jays eye $500mn Chicago Cubs superstar signing
content: A potential trade between the Toronto Blue Jays and Houston Astros could see Kyle Tucker move to Toronto. This deal would significantly impact both teams, with Toronto acquiring a star outfielder and Houston focusing on cost control and future depth. The trade involves a steep prospect cost for Toronto and potential payroll flexibility for Houston.

title: Travis Kelce at breaking point as Taylor Swift reaches new career high
content: As the Chiefs wrapped up a disappointing season, Travis Kelce faced mounting questions about his NFL future and the possibility of retirement. At the same time, Taylor Swift reached another career high, extending her historic run atop the Billboard 200. The contrast highlighted a pivotal moment for the high-profile couple, with one career pausing as the other surged forward.

title: At 8.2% interest, how does SCSS compare to bank FDs, RBI bonds, mutual funds? Explained
content: The Senior Citizens Savings Scheme is a government-backed Post Office savings option designed for retirees and senior citizens. It offers a reliable stream of regular interest income, combining higher returns with low risk.

title: AIBE 20 result released on the website: Check details here
content: The Bar Council of India has declared the AIBE-XX results for the exam held on November 30, 2025, though the result link is yet to be activated. Out of 2,51,968 candidates, 1,74,386 have qualified, taking the overall pass percentage to 69.21 per cent after revisions to the answer key. Check the direct link to downlaod the AIBE 20 result.

title: Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal announce baby boy's name; here's what 'Vihaan' means
content: Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal have revealed the name of their newborn son, Vihaan Kaushal, two months after his birth on November 7. The couple shared the joyous news on social media, expressing their gratitude and love for their "Ray of Light.

title: OTD | 7 years ago! Kohli‚Äôs India became the first Asian team to win Test series Down Under
content: Seven years ago, India achieved a historic feat by winning a Test series in Australia. This marked the first time an Asian team secured a Test series victory Down Under. The Virat Kohli-led side won both the Test and ODI series. Cheteshwar Pujara and Jasprit Bumrah were key performers. This triumph ended a 71-year wait for India.

title: Break law, lose visa: US Embassy's stern warning to students, says 'visa a privilege'
content: The US Embassy in India has warned students that violating US laws can lead to visa cancellation, deportation, and long-term travel bans. Entry into the US is a privilege, not a right, requiring continuous compliance with American regulations. This advisory follows increased scrutiny of immigration compliance and mandatory biometric checks at border points for all non-US citizens.

title: Mustafizur row: 'Very rubbish thing to do' ‚Äî Ali blasts cricket bodies
content: Moeen Ali criticized how politics is harming cricket after Mustafizur Rahman was released from KKR due to India-Bangladesh tensions. He said the game is in danger, felt sorry for Mustafizur, and blamed powerful boards for pushing agendas. Moeen added that fans suffer most while other major cricket nations stay silent.

title: ‚ÄòGlad to speak with my friend‚Äô: PM Modi holds talks with Israeli PM Netanyahu
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, conveying New Year greetings and discussing ways to strengthen the India-Israel strategic partnership. The leaders also exchanged views on the regional situation and reaffirmed their shared resolve to fight terrorism with greater determination.

title: Sooryavanshi carnage bamboozles South Africa U19s with 63-ball ton
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi continued his exceptional form, scoring a rapid 127 off 74 balls in the third U-19 ODI against South Africa. This century, following a blistering 68 in the previous match, highlights his dominance as he leads the Indian side. His explosive batting reinforces his reputation as a top young talent.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 24K gold costs in major cities - check rates
content: Gold prices experienced a slight dip on Wednesday as investors engaged in profit-booking following recent strong gains. The focus has now shifted to upcoming US economic data. Both domestic and international gold futures saw declines, with silver also trading lower after touching near-record highs.

title: ‚ÄòMilitary is always an option‚Äô: Purchase or invade? Trump weighs how US could acquire Greenland
content: President Trump is actively discussing options to acquire Greenland, including potential military use, viewing it as a national security priority. While the administration explores purchase or association agreements, Greenland and Denmark firmly oppose any such move, emphasizing Danish sovereignty and the island's right to self-determination.

title: The 25:1 problem: What India loses when students leave and don‚Äôt return
content: India‚Äôs brain drain is not just about students leaving‚Äîit is about a system that sends talent out at scale while struggling to attract it in. As outbound mobility surges and inbound remains thin, internationalisation turns one-way. The fix is not guilt or rhetoric, but making Indian campuses reliable, competitive spaces where staying‚Äîor coming‚Äîfeels like a smart, credible choice.

title: Jacob Bethell matches Kapil Dev's rare record at SCG
content: Jacob Bethell achieved a significant milestone by scoring his maiden first-class century against Australia in the Ashes Test. The 22-year-old's composed knock at the Sydney Cricket Ground places him in elite company, joining legendary England batters and a rare group of cricketers with maiden centuries in both first-class and List-A international matches.

title: Arjun Tendulkar and Saaniya Chandhok set to marry ‚Äî date finalised?
content: Arjun Tendulkar, son of legendary cricketer Sachin Tendulkar, is set to marry Saaniya Chandok in March. The couple, who got engaged last August, come from prominent families. Saaniya is involved in entrepreneurship and hails from a business family with interests in food and hospitality. Arjun is building his own cricket career as a bowling allrounder.

title: T20 WC: Bangladesh rejects ultimatum claims; BCB says ICC assures team's participation
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has received a formal response from the ICC regarding security concerns for the T20 World Cup 2026 in India. The ICC reiterated its commitment to Bangladesh's participation and assured that their inputs on security planning will be considered. The BCB has denied any ultimatum was issued, calling such reports false and unfounded.

title: Delhi demolition drive: SP MP Mohibbullah Nadvi present at site; 5 arrested
content: Delhi police have arrested five individuals following stone-pelting during a court-ordered demolition near Faiz-e-Elahi Masjid. The Municipal Corporation of Delhi cleared encroached land, including commercial establishments, leading to the incident where five police personnel were injured. Authorities assure the mosque remains safe and warn against violence and provocation.

title: Jana Nayagan cleared in UK; Thalapathy Vijay starrer gets BBFC 15, India CBFC pending
content: Jana Nayagan secured UK censor approval with a 15 rating, citing strong language and violence. Meanwhile, India's censor board delay continues, prompting producers to approach the Madras High Court. The film's release remains uncertain amid reports of potential issues in Saudi Arabia as well.

title: Why you are seeing names flashing for calls from unknown numbers?
content: India's telecom sector is rolling out Calling Name Presentation (CNAP), a new feature displaying registered caller names on incoming calls. This initiative, driven by DOT and TRAI, aims to combat rising spam and fraud by enhancing caller identification. The nationwide rollout for 4G and 5G networks is expected by March 31, 2026.

title: IPL: 'What is the fault of that poor player?' - J&K CM questions Mustafizur Rahman's exit
content: Jammu and Kashmir chief minister Omar Abdullah questioned the IPL's decision to release Bangladeshi cricketer Mustafizur Rahman, citing strained India-Bangladesh ties. He argued that removing a single player wouldn't resolve diplomatic issues and could negatively impact the upcoming T20 World Cup, with Bangladesh potentially boycotting India as host.

title: UAE offers ‚Äòcitizenship‚Äô to businesses under New Corporate Law 2026
content: UAE companies now officially hold 'citizenship' status, recognizing them as Emirati entities under a new Commercial Companies Law. This move, applicable to mainland and free-zone businesses, enhances global credibility and trade access. It clarifies that this status applies solely to the legal entity, not individual owners, bolstering the UAE's appeal for international business growth and investment.

title: BJP worker 'stripped' by police during SIR drive in Hubbali; cops deny allegations
content: A BJP worker claims police assaulted her during a voter list revision in Hubballi. The incident followed a complaint by Congress corporator Suvarna Kallakuntla. Police state the worker resisted arrest and stripped herself. Counter-complaints have been filed by both sides. Senior police officials are reviewing the situation.

title: Indian presenter breaks silence on her Bangladesh Premier League exit
content: Indian presenter Ridhima Pathak clarified she voluntarily withdrew from the Bangladesh Premier League due to the political climate, refuting reports of being dropped. This comes amid heightened India-Bangladesh tensions, including a ban on IPL broadcasts in Bangladesh following a player dispute. The situation has led to significant BPL panel changes.

title: The Mutual Fund Advisor: FD vs Mutual Funds - you are asking the wrong question!
content: If you use equity funds mainly for long-term goals of 10 years or more, combine them with the right amount of debt for stability, and behave sensibly during bad years, then yes‚Äîhistorically they have outpaced FDs by a wide margin more often than not.

title: 19 years, two daughters, zero drama: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban‚Äôs unexpected divorce story
content: Hollywood star Nicole Kidman and country singer Keith Urban have officially ended their 19-year marriage. The divorce was finalised in Nashville court on January 6, 2026. Both stars have agreed to an amicable split, with their daughters Sunday Rose and Faith Margaret remaining their top priority. They will share joint decision-making for their children.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City still keen on Gu√©hi move
content: Manchester City are looking to reinforce at center back, with Crystal Palace's Marc Gu√©hi being of interest. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Malabar shipwright's dream sails with Indian Navy
content: Indian Naval Sailing Vessel (INSV) Kaundinya was built by a team of carpenters from Malabar, led by 61-year-old master shipwright Babu Sankaran from Vadakara

title: COVID vaccine funding data ‚Äònot available‚Äô: CIC directs DPIIT to file affidavit
content: While observing that the reply given by DPIIT was appropriate, the commission said the affidavit was necessary to place the department's claim of non-availability of information on record before disposing of the appeal.

title: SIR notice issued to Nobel laureate Amartya Sen
content: The notice to Professor Sen says that the age difference between him and his parents is less than 15 years and hearing will be held at his residence on January 16 at his residence at Birbhum district

title: No one knows which dog is in what mood, says Supreme Court on animals roaming on roads
content: Top court flags non-compliance of rules and directions by civic bodies following its November 7 order to relocate stray dogs from public places, says civic bodies ‚Äúhave to implement the rules... strictly‚Äù

title: Key member of Lawrence Bishnoi gang repatriated from U.S.; held at Delhi airport
content: Wanted by the Haryana Police, Mr. Bhainswal is facing charges of offences related to murder, rioting and criminal conspiracy

title: BJP respects ex-CM Vilasrao Deshmukh as he played key role in making of Maharashtra: Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis statement comes in the wake of a controversy over State BJP chief Ravindra Chavan's recent remarks that the memories of Vilasrao Deshmukh would be "wiped out" from his hometown Latur

title: SmartCity Kochi exit row between Kerala government and  Dubai-based Tecom Investment drags on
content: While Tecom insists that any exit shall be treated under provisions of the Indo-UAE treaty, the State government has objected, arguing that the project falls under the Original Framework Agreement signed between the parties

title: Kogilu Layout demolition: FIR against four persons for selling Karnataka government land for unauthorised construction in Bengaluru
content: The irregularities were revealed during demolition of over 150 illegal houses and sheds on land earmarked for a solid waste processing unit in north Bengaluru

title: After relief from Supreme Court to others, another Delhi riots accused files bail plea seeking parity
content: The bail application was filed by Salim Malik alias Munna, one of the 11 alleged organisers and speakers of the anti-CAA/NRC meeting

title: Supreme Court declines to entertain plea seeking probe into alleged CLAT 2026 paper leak
content: The plea alleged that videos and screenshots of the paper started circulating online nearly 15 hours before the examination was scheduled to begin.

title: 42 illegal resorts around Sathyamangalam Tiger Reserve told to shut down by January 12
content: Environmental activist R. Karpagam of Coimbatore had filed a public interest litigation (PIL) petition in 2022, alleging that illegal resorts functioning within the reserve were causing severe environmental damage to the hill region

title: Comments on social media: Supreme Court grants protection from arrest to singer Neha Singh Rathore
content: The Lucknow Bench of the Allahabad High Court on December 5 last year had rejected the anticipatory bail plea filed by the folk singer

title: Sabarimala gold case: M.B. Rajesh dares Satheesan to refute Kerala HC observation of no govt interference in probe
content: Minister says High Court observation is ‚Äòa rejection of Satheesan‚Äôs misleading narrative‚Äô that Kerala government inserted two politically partisan officers into SIT to protect CPI(M) interests

title: T.N. Forest dept. denies permission for further exploratory tests at Upper Bhavani hydroelectric project site
content: Conservationists who spoke to The Hindu said that the project would heap a tremendous amount of pressure onto the ecologically fragile area, home to a number of key species of flora and fauna

title: Understand the difference: Rahul Gandhi takes dig at government over Trump‚Äôs remarks
content: Earlier, Mr. Trump said that Prime Minister Modi is ‚Äúnot that happy with me‚Äù because of the tariffs imposed by Washington on Delhi for its purchases of Russian oil

title: Step into Pongal with a village-style harvest spread
content: Pongal Thiruvizha Virundhu offers a farm-to-table celebration of Tamil Nadu‚Äôs harvest heritage, featuring a traditional village harvest recipes, and immersive Pongal activities at a farm in Thindivanam

title: Jamaat-e-Islami Hind says will vote for ‚Äòwinnable‚Äô LDF, UDF candidates in Kerala Assembly polls to keep BJP at bay
content: Admitting that the same stance was taken in recent local body polls, Jamaat-e-Islami Hind Kerala amir P. Mujeeb Rahman says the ‚Äòmain agenda‚Äô of the organisation is to keep BJP away from power in Kerala

title: Amendments to Forest Conservation Act opened door for privatisation of forest management: Congress
content: Congress leaders claim recent changes to the Forest (Conservation) Act facilitate the leasing of forest land to private entities, raising concerns over environmental governance and long-term impacts on India‚Äôs forest management

title: Andhra Minister Narayana launches Land Pooling Scheme-II in Amaravati
content: Minister Narayana announced ‚Çπ1.50 lakh debt waiver for families who gave their lands for construction of the Capital Amaravati

title: Ballari range DIG transferred after clash that killed Congress party worker in Karnataka
content: In another key posting, Sumana D. Pennekar, who was serving as Deputy Commissioner of Police (Intelligence), Bengaluru, has been appointed as Superintendent of Police, Ballari district

title:
PM Modi speaks with Netanyahu, discusses 
India-Israel strategic ties, Gaza peace plan
content: The two leaders resolved to fight terrorism with greater determination, PM Narendra Modi said on social media; he ‚Äúreaffirmed India‚Äôs consistent support for efforts towards a just and durable peace in the region‚Äù

title: Mauritius President visits Tirumala temple
content: Mauritius President Dharambeer Gokhool was accorded a traditional reception by Endowments Minister Anam Ramnarayan Reddy, TTD Chairman B.R. Naidu, and Executive Officer Anil Kumar Singhal

title: NHAI‚Äôs world records in Andhra Pradesh are a proud moment: CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: The CM conveyed best wishes to the team as two more Guinness World Records are being attempted in the second and third packages of NH-544G

title: Claim of residing at now-demolished houses at Kogilu for 28 years ‚Äòfactually incorrect‚Äô, State Government tells Karnataka High Court
content: Authorities have satellite images to show when houses were constructed, Advocate General tells the court during hearing of PIL petition filed by three women, who were among those whose houses were demolished

title: Watch: Ahead of Pongal, jaggery production in full swing in Vellore
content: Behind the scenes at a village in Vellore district, Tamil Nadu, that is engaged in jaggery production for two generations. These farmers produce about 200 kg of jaggery per day.

title: IUML leader V.K. Ebrahim Kunju laid to rest with State honours
content: The body was kept at his residence in Aluva for public homage till 9 a.m in the morning. Several persons paid last respects to the departed leader at his residence and later at Alangad Juma Masjid

title: Supreme Court asks govt to forward entire audio clip allegedly on former Manipur CM Biren Singh
content: The court told the government to forward it to the NFSU for expedite action and submission of report in a sealed cover

title: Probe ordered into alleged medical negligence in Wayanad hospital after woman finds cotton cloth left inside post-cesarean
content: Decision to carry out investigation taken after 21-year-old woman submitted a complaint to Minister O.R. Kelu alleging¬†lapses in her treatment

title: Dindigul after dark
content: At Ponram, Dindigul Nights brings together memories,family recipes, and regional favourites just the way they‚Äôve been cooked and eaten for generations to recreatethe flavours of late evenings in Dindigul .

title: DGGI arrests Orange Transport MD, another businessman in ‚Çπ50-crore GST evasion cases
content: Sunil Kumar and N. Chethan have been accused of GST evasion and orchestrating fake ITC racket respectively

title: NGO rescues 14 illegally relocated puppies in Chikkaballapur
content: Officials of the Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) said they have not received any complaint of illegal relocation

title: Truck driver‚Äôs death in alleged illegal quarry: Karnataka Upa Lokayukta books AC, tahsildar, DySP, seven others for dereliction of duty
content: The action follows an online news report about a truck loaded with construction stones plunging into a gorge at a stone-crushing unit in Mandya district in Karnataka

title: Delhi Assembly Winter session: Ruckus continues as BJP protests Atishi‚Äôs remarks
content: BJP protests Ms. Atishi‚Äôs remarks allegedly insulting Guru Tegh Bahadur; Speaker Vijender Gupta says unfortunate that no communication¬†has been made regarding the matter

title: BJP, Congress team up to keep Sena out of local body, Fadnavis vows action for ‚Äòindiscipline‚Äô
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis orders cancellation of alliances formed to run Ambarnath Municipal Council, Congress serves notices to its councillors

title: Cold conditions persist in parts of India

title: Watch: Pop-up bike library in Thoothukudi is getting people to read more

content: The alleged incident took place when police went to arrest the woman based on complaints of local residents in connection with a clash that reportedly took place during the mapping for SIR on January 1

content: Since the revival of the AIADMK-BJP ties in April 2025, the PMK is the first party of considerable following to join the coalition

content: A card game, centering disabled authors and designed with tactile cues, aims to reimagine how Braille, literature, and pedagogy can intersect in contemporary classrooms

content: The driver alerted the passengers about the short circuit before parking the bus on the Gammon bridge

title: Man held for death of couple in Tiruvannamalai
content: Based on an alert from residents, Chengam police inspected the spot and sent the bodies to Government Medical College Hospital in Tiruvannamalai town for postmortem

title: When eggs, stones were hurled at T.N. Governor Channa Reddy‚Äôs convoy and CM Jayalalithaa sought his recall
content: The incident occurred in 1995 when hostilities between Jayalalithaa and Reddy were common knowledge. While the Governor sent a report to the Centre against the AIADMK government, the Chief Minister wrote to President Shankar Dayal Sharma and Prime Minister P.V. Narasimha Rao.

title: Bihar‚Äôs Rajgir hills welcomes migratory birds from Europe, Central Asia
content: Environment, Forest and Climate Forest Department‚Äôs December 2025 survey found 135 species of birds including 33 migratory birds in Rajgir hills

content: The order applies to all recognised schools affiliated with the CBSE, ICSE, IB, the Uttar Pradesh Board and other boards operating in the district

content: Land carries deep cultural and emotional significance, anchoring identity, heritage and community ties, curator Ina Puri says

content: The Commission emphasised that minor errors in voters' names do not affect the hearing process or a voter's rights, and authorities have been warned to avoid creating public disputes over such technicalities

title: BJP planning to manipulate electoral rolls, ‚Äòdelete names of 10,000 voters‚Äô: Assam MLA
content: Akhil Gogoi says  MLAs and district presidents were given a January 12 deadline to submit booth-wise lists of voters who do not vote for the BJP, so that their names could be deleted

title: Doctors‚Äô stir: Odisha govt. invokes ESMA
content: Over 6000 doctors in 32 district headquarter hospitals, 300 community health centres and other primary health centres are participating in the strike

title: Luxembourg 'very important' partner for India: Jaishankar
content: New Delhi and Luxembourg can collaborate much more on many interesting issues, including fintech, space, the digital world, and AI, the External Affairs Minister said

title: NMC withdraws Mata Vaishno Devi varsity‚Äôs MBBS list with 42 Muslim candidates citing 'non-compliance'; BJP welcomes move
content: Officials said the NMC‚Äôs Medical Assessment and Rating Board withdrew the Letter of Permission granted to the varsity in Reasi for running the MBBS course with 50 seats for 2025-26

title: Grok obscene AI content: govt. gives X time till January 7 to submit report
content: The government had issued a stern warning to the Elon Musk-led social media platform over indecent and sexually-explicit content being generated through misuse of AI-based services like 'Grok' and other tools

title: Kalamassery municipality seeks easing of curbs on construction works
content: Restrictions under green zone regulation will impact setting up of buildings on land proposed for judicial city, says municipal chairperson

title: Venezuela's Political Transition Can Keep Global Oil Prices Lower: Report
content: Venezuela could become one of the biggest sources of new oil supply in the world over the next decade if it undergoes a political transition, potentially reshaping global energy markets and keeping oil prices lower for longer, said a JPMorgan report.

title: S Jaishankar Urged To Discuss Baby Ariha Shah Case With German Chancellor
content: John Brittas, CPI(M) MP from Kerala, has written a letter to S Jaishankar, urging urgent high-level diplomatic intervention during the forthcoming visit of the German Chancellor, Friedrich Merz, to secure the repatriation of Baby Ariha Shah.

title: 'It Is Over': Why A Deleted Op-Ed By Gen Z Student Is Going Viral In Pakistan
content: Pakistan might be witnessing its own Gen Z uprising, not through protests and violence, but in ideas that refused to be silenced in the face of brute force.

title: "Sir, May I See You Please?" Trump's Latest Claim On PM Modi
content: US President Donald Trump said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi directly raised an issue with him over the delivery of American-made Apache helicopters and called him "sir".

title: India's GDP Expected To Grow At 7.4% In 2025-26: Centre's Advance Estimates
content: India's GDP is expected to grow at a rate of 7.4% in the current financial year, up from 6.5% in 2024-25, the Centre has said in advance estimates released on Wednesday.

title: "Mohun Baingan, East Baingan": Trinamool Mocks Sports Minister's Flub
content: A mispronunciation by Union Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has sparked a political firestorm, with the Trinamool Congress accusing the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP)-led central government of disrespecting Bengal's cultural heritage.

title: After Congress, A BJP-AIMIM Tie-Up? Maharashtra Throws Up Another Surprise
content: The local unit of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) had entered into a direct alliance with the All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) in the Akot Municipal Council of Akola district, triggering a fierce political debate.

title: Israel's Netanyahu Calls PM Modi, Briefs On Gaza Peace Plan Status
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday received a phone call from his Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu, who shared an update on the Gaza Peace Plan and reaffirmed their shared resolve to fight terror.

title: Amid IndiGo Crisis Probe, India Seeks Fare Data From Airlines
content: India's government has asked IndiGo, Air India, SpiceJet and Akasa to provide data on average fares charged, a document shows, as antitrust authorities investigate unprecedented travel disruptions in December.

title: UN Accuses Israel Of "Systematic Discrimination" Against Palestinians
content: The United Nations on Wednesday said decades of discrimination and segregation of Palestinians by Israel in the West Bank were intensifying, and called on the country to end its "apartheid system".

title: Ex-Japanese Governor Sent 1,000 Sexually Harassing Texts To Staff: Report
content: A former governor in Japan accused of sexual harassment allegedly sent more than 1,000 inappropriate text messages to staff

title: "Can't Read A Dog's Mind When He Is In A Mood To Bite": Supreme Court
content: Amid the rising dog bite incidents, the Supreme Court, on November 7, last year, ordered the removal of stray dogs from educational institutions, hospitals, bus stands, sports complexes, and railway stations.

title: Bengal Girl Murdered In Bengaluru, Body Wrapped In Bag, Dumped In Drain
content: A six-year-old girl was murdered in Bengaluru. According to the police, her body was wrapped in a plastic bag and dumped in a drain. The crime happened near the city's posh Whitefield area.

title: Behind Pakistan's Teen Spy Network, A Design To Brainwash Minors
content: A spy network of teenagers has emerged as a major security challenge in India after white-collar terrorism, with Pakistan's intelligence agency now found to be trapping and brainwashing minors to work for them.

title: Kannada Actor Dhanush Raj Alleges Physical Assault, Harassment By Wife
content: Kannada actor Dhanush Raj has filed a police complaint against his wife Arshita, accusing her of physical assault. Police have also registered a counter-complaint based on allegations made by Arshita against the actor, alleging dowry harassment.

title: Pak Propaganda Busted, Here's How Islamabad Ran For Help During Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan ran to the US for help during Indian airstrikes on their airbases and terror camps, US government filings have revealed, exposing Pakistani lies and misinformation campaign during Operation Sindoor.

title: Engineer, 26, Falls From 16th Floor Of Building In Bengaluru, Dies
content: A 26-year-old, who had finished his education in electronic engineering in Europe and had returned to India recently to start working, died after falling from the 16th floor of a building in Bengaluru.

title: Amsterdam Airport Cancels 700 Flights Due To Severe Snow, Wind Disruptions
content: Amsterdam Schiphol Airport, one of the largest in Europe, announced at least 700 flight cancellations Wednesday because of snow and wind, following days of weather-related travel disruptions.

title: Mosque, Graveyard And A Court Order: Behind Delhi Demolition Clash
content: A violent clash erupted early this morning during an anti-encroachment drive near a mosque in Delhi. Locals threw stones at municipal officials and police teams during the demolition on a land adjoining the Syed Faiz Elahi mosque at Ramlila Maidan.

title: In Maharashtra Town, BJP-Congress Unite To Keep Sena Out, Then Suspensions
content: The political developments in the Ambernath Municipal Council of Thane district have triggered a major churn not only in the local politics but also across Maharashtra.

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: Tracking live who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: The playoffs are here! Our guide to all 14 teams, from favorites to underdogs
content: the field for the 2025 NFL season's playoffs is set after the Steelers beat the Ravens in a season-ending classic . the no. 1 seeds in each conference -- the Broncos in the AFC and Seahawks -- will receive first-round byes . each of the 14 playoff teams needs to do to reach the super Bowl .

title: Move over, blue bloods! This playoff belongs to the 'new bloods'
content: new bloods will replace blue bloods on college football's biggest postseason stage . julian zelizer: it's a basketball school that is leading the movement . she says if the Hurricanes win a national championship, they'll be able to win .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where Mavs, Hawks and others stack up ahead of trade deadline
content: there is less than one month until the 2026 trade deadline . the two teams are open to trade talks . it's yet to be seen how the trade deadline will impact the standings . both the Detroit Pistons and Oklahoma City Thunder stand firmly at the top of their conferences .

title: Top news of the day: BJP, Congress team up to keep ally Shiv Sena out of power in Ambarnath; GDP to grow at 7.4% in 2025-26, and more
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!
